TITLE: A2A and MCP Protocol Comparison
DESCRIPTION: Details the complementary roles of the Agent2Agent Protocol (A2A) and the Model Context Protocol (MCP) in agentic systems. A2A focuses on agent-to-agent communication and collaboration, while MCP standardizes interaction with external resources like tools and APIs. They work together by A2A agents delegating tasks to other agents, which may then use MCP to interact with underlying tools.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/specification.md#_snippet_67

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
Protocol Comparison:

Agent2Agent Protocol (A2A):
  Focus: Standardizing communication and collaboration between independent AI agents.
  Functionality: Agent discovery, negotiation of modalities, task management, exchange of conversational context and results.
  Analogy: How agents partner or delegate work.

Model Context Protocol (MCP):
  Focus: Standardizing how AI models and agents connect to and interact with external resources (tools, APIs, data sources).
  Functionality: Describing tool capabilities, passing inputs, receiving structured outputs.
  Analogy: The "how-to" for an agent to use a specific capability or access a resource.

Synergy:
  An A2A client agent requests a task from an A2A server agent.
  The server agent may use MCP to interact with multiple underlying tools or APIs to fulfill the A2A task.

Reference: https://modelcontextprotocol.io/
```

TITLE: A2A Data Structures
DESCRIPTION: Defines the data structures used within the A2A protocol for representing parts of artifacts, file references, task artifacts, authentication, push notifications, and message parameters.

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:

Part:
  type: "data"

  mimeType: (string) Format specification (e.g., "application/json").

AuthenticationInfo:

PushNotificationConfig:

TaskPushNotificationConfig:

MessageSendParams:

  configuration: (MessageSendConfiguration) Optional configuration for the message.

TITLE: A2A Protocol Overview
DESCRIPTION: Describes the Agent2Agent (A2A) Protocol as an open standard for AI agent communication, emphasizing interoperability and collaboration. It also explains its relationship with the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/index.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
Agent2Agent (A2A) Protocol:
  Purpose: Enables seamless communication and collaboration between AI agents.
  Key Features:
    - Interoperability: Connects agents built on different platforms (e.g., LangGraph, CrewAI, Semantic Kernel).
    - Complex Workflows: Facilitates delegation, information exchange, and coordination between agents.
    - Security & Opacity: Agents interact without sharing internal memory, tools, or proprietary logic.

Model Context Protocol (MCP):
  Purpose: Connects agents to tools, APIs, and resources with structured inputs/outputs.
  Role: The way agents access their capabilities.

Relationship between A2A and MCP:
  - Complementary standards for building robust agentic applications.
  - MCP handles tool access; A2A handles peer-to-peer agent communication.

Related Resources:
  - ADK (Agent Development Kit)
  - Python Tutorial
```

TITLE: Parallel Task Follow-ups
DESCRIPTION: Agents support parallel work by creating distinct tasks for each follow-up message within the same contextId. This allows for tracking individual tasks and creating dependent tasks upon prerequisite completion.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/topics/life-of-a-task.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
ParallelFollowups:
  Mechanism: Agents create distinct, parallel tasks for each follow-up message within the same contextId.
  Example:
    Task 1: Book flight to Helsinki.
    (After Task 1 completes)
    Task 2: Book hotel based on Task 1.
    Task 3: Book snowmobile activity based on Task 1.
    (After Task 2 completes, while Task 3 is in progress)
    Task 4: Add spa reservation based on Task 2.
```

TITLE: A2A In-Task Authentication (Secondary Credentials)
DESCRIPTION: Details the process for handling secondary authentication requirements during task execution. If an agent needs credentials for a different system, it transitions the task to 'auth-required' and provides details in TaskStatus.message.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/specification.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
In-Task Authentication:
1. State Transition: Agent SHOULD transition A2A task to 'auth-required' state.
2. Information Provision: TaskStatus.message (e.g., DataPart) SHOULD detail secondary authentication needs (e.g., PushNotificationAuthenticationInfo-like structure).
3. Credential Handling: A2A Client obtains new credentials out-of-band and provides them in a subsequent message/send or message/stream request.
```

TITLE: AgentCard Object Structure
DESCRIPTION: Defines the core structure of the Agent Card, which describes an A2A server's identity, capabilities, and interaction details. This JSON document is used by clients for agent discovery and configuration.

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:

/**
 * Represents the main Agent Card structure.
 */
interface AgentCard {
  /**
   * A unique identifier for the agent.
   */
  id: string;
  /**
   * The human-readable name of the agent.
   */
  name: string;
  /**
   * A brief description of the agent's purpose.
   */
  description: string;
  /**
   * Information about the organization providing the agent.
   */
  provider: AgentProvider;
  /**
   * The primary endpoint URL for interacting with the agent.
   */
  endpoint: string;
  /**
   * Specifies optional A2A protocol features supported by the agent.
   */
  capabilities?: AgentCapabilities;
  /**
   * Describes the authentication requirements for accessing the agent's endpoint.
   */
  securitySchemes?: { [key: string]: SecurityScheme };
  /**
   * Declares a combination of the target URL and supported transport for agent interaction.
   */
  interfaces?: AgentInterface[];
  /**
   * Describes specific capabilities, functions, or areas of expertise the agent can perform.
   */
  skills?: AgentSkill[];
  /**
   * Version of the Agent Card specification.
   */
  version: string;
}
```

TITLE: Agent Card Discovery: Well-Known URI
DESCRIPTION: Details the standardized mechanism for A2A agents to discover each other's Agent Cards by accessing a well-known URI on the agent's domain, following RFC 8615 principles.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/topics/agent-discovery.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
Agent Card Well-Known URI Discovery:

Mechanism: A2A Servers host their Agent Card at a standardized, "well-known" path on their domain.
Standard Path: `https://{agent-server-domain}/.well-known/agent.json`

Process:
1. Client agent identifies the domain of a potential A2A Server (e.g., `smart-thermostat.example.com`).
2. Client performs an HTTP `GET` request to the well-known URI: `https://smart-thermostat.example.com/.well-known/agent.json`.
3. If the Agent Card exists and is accessible, the server returns it as a JSON response.

Advantages:
- Simple and standardized.
- Enables automated discovery by crawlers.

Considerations:
- Best suited for agents intended for open discovery.
- The endpoint may require authentication if the card contains sensitive information.
```

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:

GET /.well-known/agent.json HTTP/1.1
Host: smart-thermostat.example.com
Accept: application/json
```

TITLE: A2A Webhook Security Best Practices
DESCRIPTION: This section details security measures for A2A servers sending notifications to client webhooks. It covers URL validation strategies and authentication methods.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/topics/streaming-and-async.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
Webhook URL Validation:
  - Servers SHOULD NOT blindly trust client-provided URLs in PushNotificationConfig to prevent SSRF attacks.
  - Mitigation Strategies:
    - Allowlisting: Maintain an allowlist of trusted domains or IP ranges.
    - Ownership Verification / Challenge-Response: Perform a verification step by issuing an HTTP GET or OPTIONS request with a unique 'validationToken' to the proposed webhook URL. The webhook service must respond appropriately to prove ownership and reachability.
    - Network Controls: Use egress firewalls or network policies to restrict outbound HTTP requests.

Authenticating to Client Webhook:
  - Servers MUST authenticate according to schemes specified in PushNotificationConfig.authentication.
  - Common Authentication Schemes:
    - Bearer Tokens (OAuth 2.0):
      - Obtain an access token for the client's webhook audience/scope.
      - Include in the 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' header.
    - API Keys:
      - Include a pre-shared API key in a specific HTTP header (e.g., 'X-Api-Key').
    - HMAC Signatures:
      - Sign the request payload with a shared secret key using HMAC.
      - Include the signature in a header (e.g., 'X-Hub-Signature').
      - The receiver verifies the signature.
    - Mutual TLS (mTLS):
      - Present a client TLS certificate if supported by the client's webhook infrastructure.
```

#!/bin/bash
# start-rag-server.sh - Script wrapper para iniciar MCP RAG Server com variÃ¡veis de ambiente

echo "ğŸš€ Iniciando MCP RAG Server com configuraÃ§Ã£o correta..."

# Definir variÃ¡veis de ambiente para o RAG Server
export RAG_MODEL="all-MiniLM-L6-v2"
export RAG_CACHE_DIR="$HOME/.claude/mcp-rag-cache"
export RAG_LOG_LEVEL="INFO"
export RAG_MAX_DOCUMENTS="10000"
export RAG_EMBEDDING_BATCH_SIZE="32"
export PYTHONPATH="/Users/agents/.claude/mcp-rag-server"

echo "ğŸ“Š VariÃ¡veis de ambiente configuradas:"
echo "RAG_MODEL: $RAG_MODEL"
echo "RAG_CACHE_DIR: $RAG_CACHE_DIR"
echo "RAG_LOG_LEVEL: $RAG_LOG_LEVEL"
echo "RAG_MAX_DOCUMENTS: $RAG_MAX_DOCUMENTS"
echo "PYTHONPATH: $PYTHONPATH"

# Mudar para o diretÃ³rio correto
cd "$(dirname "$0")"

# Verificar se o ambiente virtual existe
if [ ! -d "venv" ]; then
    echo "âš ï¸  Ambiente virtual nÃ£o encontrado. Criando..."
    python3 -m venv venv
    source venv/bin/activate
    pip install -r requirements.txt
else
    echo "âœ… Usando ambiente virtual existente"
fi

# Verificar se o diretÃ³rio de cache existe
if [ ! -d "$RAG_CACHE_DIR" ]; then
    echo "ğŸ“ Criando diretÃ³rio de cache..."
    mkdir -p "$RAG_CACHE_DIR"
fi

# Iniciar o MCP RAG Server diretamente
echo "ğŸ”„ Iniciando servidor..."
exec /Users/agents/.claude/mcp-rag-server/venv/bin/python /Users/agents/.claude/mcp-rag-server/rag_server.py

file.content:
# A2A Protocol: Quick Start

## Setup (30 segundos)
```bash
pip install a2a-sdk httpx fastapi uvicorn
```

## Agente MÃ­nimo Funcional
```python
# agent.py
from fastapi import FastAPI
app = FastAPI()

@app.get("/.well-known/agent.json")
def agent_card():
    return {
        "name": "hello-agent",
        "skills": [{
            "name": "greet",
            "parameters": {"name": "string"}
        }]
    }

@app.post("/tasks")
async def create_task(req: dict):
    return {
        "jsonrpc": "2.0",
        "result": {
            "id": "task-123",
            "status": "completed",
            "result": f"Hello {req['params']['name']}!"
        }
    }

# Rodar: uvicorn agent:app --port 8000
```

## Cliente para Testar
```python
# client.py
import httpx, asyncio

async def test():
    async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
        # Descobrir agente
        agent = await client.get("http://localhost:8000/.well-known/agent.json")
        print(f"Skills: {agent.json()['skills']}")
        
        # Executar tarefa
        result = await client.post("http://localhost:8000/tasks", json={
            "jsonrpc": "2.0",
            "method": "greet",
            "params": {"name": "World"},
            "id": 1
        })
        print(result.json()['result']['result'])

asyncio.run(test())
```

## Componentes A2A

### Agent Card
```json
{
  "name": "agent-id",           // Identificador Ãºnico
  "skills": [{                  // O que o agente faz
    "name": "skill-name",
    "parameters": {}
  }],
  "capabilities": {              // Recursos suportados
    "streaming": true,           // SSE
    "pushNotifications": true    // Webhooks
  }
}
```

### Task States
```
CREATED â†’ RUNNING â†’ COMPLETED
          â†“     â†“
        FAILED  CANCELLED
```

### Message Format
```json
{
  "messageId": "uuid",
  "role": "user|agent",
  "parts": [{"text": "..."}]
}
```

## A2A vs MCP (1 minuto)

```
A2A:  [Agent A] â†â†’ [Agent B] â†â†’ [Agent C]
      ColaboraÃ§Ã£o horizontal entre IAs

MCP:  [Agent] â†’ [Database/API/Tool]

Com base na documentaÃ§Ã£o encontrada sobre A2A Protocol, aqui estÃ¡ um resumo das informaÃ§Ãµes principais disponÃ­veis no sistema:

## ğŸ“š **InformaÃ§Ãµes sobre A2A Protocol no Sistema**

### **LocalizaÃ§Ã£o dos Documentos A2A**

```bash
/Users/agents/.claude/docs/
â”œâ”€â”€ 01-introducao/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ aula-01-a2a-fundamentos-tecnicos.md  # Fundamentos tÃ©cnicos do A2A
â”œâ”€â”€ agentes-reais/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ CONFORMIDADE-A2A.md                  # Checklist de conformidade
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ CERTIFICADO-A2A.md                   # CertificaÃ§Ãµes A2A
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ marvin/
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ A2A-PADRONIZACAO.md             # PadrÃµes A2A detalhados
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ TUTORIAL-CURL-A2A.md            # Tutorial prÃ¡tico com curl
```

### **Principais Conceitos A2A Documentados**

#### **1. Agent Cards**
- Arquivo JSON que descreve as capacidades do agente
- Servido em `/.well-known/agent.json`
- Campos obrigatÃ³rios: name, skills, capabilities
- Permite descoberta automÃ¡tica de agentes

#### **2. Estrutura A2A**
```json
{
  "name": "agent-id",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "skills": [{
    "name": "skill-name",
    "parameters": {},
    "description": "O que a skill faz"
  }],
  "capabilities": {
    "streaming": true,
    "max_concurrent_tasks": 10,
    "protocol_version": "1.0"
  }
}
```

#### **3. Estados de Tarefas**
- **CREATED**: Tarefa criada
- **RUNNING**: Em execuÃ§Ã£o
- **COMPLETED**: Finalizada com sucesso
- **FAILED**: Falhou
- **CANCELLED**: Cancelada

#### **4. DiferenÃ§a A2A vs MCP**
- **A2A**: ComunicaÃ§Ã£o horizontal entre agentes (Agent-to-Agent)
- **MCP**: IntegraÃ§Ã£o vertical com ferramentas (Model-Context Protocol)
- Ambos sÃ£o complementares, nÃ£o competem

### **ImplementaÃ§Ãµes A2A no Sistema**

1. **Marvin Agent** (100% conforme)
   - Porta: 9998
   - ExtraÃ§Ã£o de dados estruturados
   - Suporte a streaming
   - CLI completo com click

2. **HelloWorld Agent** (100% conforme)
   - Porta: 9999
   - Agente bÃ¡sico de demonstraÃ§Ã£o
   - ImplementaÃ§Ã£o mÃ­nima A2A

### **Como Acessar InformaÃ§Ãµes A2A**

```bash
# Ver documentaÃ§Ã£o completa
cat /Users/agents/.claude/docs/01-introducao/aula-01-a2a-fundamentos-tecnicos.md

# Ver checklist de conformidade
cat /Users/agents/.claude/docs/agentes-reais/CONFORMIDADE-A2A.md

# Ver tutorial prÃ¡tico
cat /Users/agents/.claude/docs/agentes-reais/marvin/TUTORIAL-CURL-A2A.md

# Ver padronizaÃ§Ã£o detalhada
cat /Users/agents/.claude/docs/agentes-reais/marvin/A2A-PADRONIZACAO.md
```

### **Recursos A2A DisponÃ­veis**

- SDK oficial: `a2a-sdk`
- Servidor padrÃ£o: `A2AStarletteApplication`
- Cliente: `A2AClient` para comunicaÃ§Ã£o entre agentes
- Suporte a SSE (Server-Sent Events)
- JSON-RPC 2.0 como protocolo base

O RAG server MCP contÃ©m essas informaÃ§Ãµes indexadas e pode ser consultado, mas as ferramentas MCP especÃ­ficas para RAG nÃ£o estÃ£o diretamente expostas nesta sessÃ£o. A documentaÃ§Ã£o A2A estÃ¡ organizada nos diretÃ³rios mencionados acima.

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
IntegraÃ§Ã£o do Marvin Agent com MCP RAG Server
Permite ao Marvin acessar a base de conhecimento sobre A2A Protocol
"""

import os
import sys
import json
import asyncio
import logging
import subprocess
from pathlib import Path
from typing import Dict, Any, List, Optional
from datetime import datetime

# Configurar logging
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

class RAGIntegration:
    """
    Integra o Marvin Agent com o MCP RAG Server
    """
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.rag_server_path = Path("/Users/agents/.claude/mcp-rag-server")
        self.rag_venv_python = self.rag_server_path / "venv" / "bin" / "python"
        self.rag_server_script = self.rag_server_path / "rag_server.py"
        self.rag_process = None
        self.is_rag_running = False
        
        # Adicionar o path do RAG server ao PYTHONPATH
        if str(self.rag_server_path) not in sys.path:
            sys.path.insert(0, str(self.rag_server_path))
    
    def check_rag_server(self) -> bool:
        """
        Verifica se o RAG server estÃ¡ rodando
        """
        try:
            # Verificar se o processo estÃ¡ rodando
            result = subprocess.run(
                ["pgrep", "-f", "rag_server.py"],
                capture_output=True,
                text=True
            )
            return result.returncode == 0
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Erro ao verificar RAG server: {e}")
            return False
    
    def start_rag_server(self) -> bool:
        """
        Inicia o RAG server se nÃ£o estiver rodando
        """
        if self.check_rag_server():
            logger.info("RAG server jÃ¡ estÃ¡ rodando")
            self.is_rag_running = True
            return True
        
        try:
            logger.info("Iniciando RAG server...")
            
            # Configurar ambiente
            env = os.environ.copy()
            env['RAG_MODEL'] = "all-MiniLM-L6-v2"
            env['RAG_CACHE_DIR'] = str(Path.home() / ".claude" / "mcp-rag-cache")
            env['RAG_LOG_LEVEL'] = "INFO"
            env['PYTHONPATH'] = str(self.rag_server_path)
            
            # Iniciar processo
            self.rag_process = subprocess.Popen(
                [str(self.rag_venv_python), str(self.rag_server_script)],
                cwd=str(self.rag_server_path),
                env=env,
                stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
                stderr=subprocess.PIPE
            )
            
            # Aguardar inicializaÃ§Ã£o
            import time
            time.sleep(3)
            
            if self.check_rag_server():
                logger.info("âœ… RAG server iniciado com sucesso")
                self.is_rag_running = True
                return True
            else:
                logger.error("âŒ Falha ao iniciar RAG server")
                return False
                
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Erro ao iniciar RAG server: {e}")
            return False
    
    async def query_rag(self, query: str, category: Optional[str] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:

        """
        try:
            # Importar mÃ³dulos do RAG server
            import sys
            sys.path.insert(0, str(self.rag_server_path))
            
            from a2a_content_manager import A2AContentManager
            
            # Criar instÃ¢ncia do content manager
            manager = A2AContentManager()
            
            # Fazer a busca
            if category:
                results = manager.search_by_category(query, category)
            else:
                results = manager.search(query)
            
            return {
                "success": True,
                "results": results,
                "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
            }
            
        except ImportError as e:
            logger.error(f"Erro ao importar RAG modules: {e}")
            return {
                "success": False,
                "error": "RAG modules not available",
                "message": str(e)
            }
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Erro ao consultar RAG: {e}")
            return {
                "success": False,
                "error": str(e)
            }
    
    async def get_a2a_info(self, topic: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        ObtÃ©m informaÃ§Ãµes especÃ­ficas sobre A2A Protocol
        """
        logger.info(f"Buscando informaÃ§Ãµes sobre A2A: {topic}")
        
        # TÃ³picos conhecidos de A2A
        a2a_topics = {
            "agent_cards": "Agent Cards estrutura metadados JSON",
            "protocol": "A2A Protocol comunicaÃ§Ã£o agentes",
            "skills": "Skills habilidades agentes A2A",
            "tasks": "Tasks tarefas estados A2A",
            "streaming": "Streaming SSE Server-Sent Events A2A",
            "discovery": "Discovery descoberta agentes well-known",
            "conformance": "Conformidade padrÃµes A2A checklist",
            "implementation": "ImplementaÃ§Ã£o servidor A2A SDK",
            "examples": "Exemplos cÃ³digo A2A Python FastAPI",
            "vs_mcp": "A2A vs MCP diferenÃ§a horizontal vertical"
        }
        
        # Buscar query apropriada
        search_query = a2a_topics.get(topic.lower(), topic)
        
        # Consultar RAG
        result = await self.query_rag(search_query, category="a2a_protocol")
        
        if result["success"] and result.get("results"):
            # Formatar resposta
            formatted_results = []
            for item in result["results"][:5]:  # Top 5 resultados
                formatted_results.append({
                    "title": item.get("title", ""),
                    "content": item.get("content", ""),
                    "relevance": item.get("score", 0)
                })
            
            return {
                "topic": topic,
                "results": formatted_results,
                "total_found": len(result["results"]),

            }
        else:
            return {
                "topic": topic,
                "results": [],
                "error": result.get("error", "No results found"),
                "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
            }
    
    async def enhance_response_with_rag(self, query: str, base_response: str) -> str:
        """

        """
        # Buscar informaÃ§Ãµes relevantes
        rag_result = await self.query_rag(query)

            for item in rag_result["results"][:3]:
                enhanced += f"\nâ€¢ {item.get('title', 'Info')}: {item.get('summary', '')[:200]}..."
            
            return enhanced
        else:
            return base_response
    
    def stop_rag_server(self):

    """

    async def process_with_rag(self, query: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """

        """
        logger.info(f"Processando com RAG: {query}")
        
        # Verificar cache
        cache_key = query.lower().strip()
        if cache_key in self.knowledge_cache:
            logger.info("Usando cache de conhecimento")
            return self.knowledge_cache[cache_key]
        
        # Identificar tipo de consulta
        query_lower = query.lower()
        
        # Consultas sobre A2A
        if any(term in query_lower for term in ["a2a", "agent card", "protocol", "skill"]):
            # Buscar no RAG
            if "agent card" in query_lower:
                result = await self.rag.get_a2a_info("agent_cards")
            elif "skill" in query_lower:
                result = await self.rag.get_a2a_info("skills")
            elif "task" in query_lower:
                result = await self.rag.get_a2a_info("tasks")
            elif "vs mcp" in query_lower or "diferenÃ§a" in query_lower:
                result = await self.rag.get_a2a_info("vs_mcp")
            else:
                result = await self.rag.get_a2a_info("protocol")
            
            # Formatar resposta
            if result.get("results"):
                response = self.format_rag_response(result)
            else:
                response = {
                    "response": "NÃ£o encontrei informaÃ§Ãµes especÃ­ficas sobre isso no RAG.",
                    "source": "default"
                }
        else:
            # Query genÃ©rica
            rag_result = await self.rag.query_rag(query)
            if rag_result["success"] and rag_result.get("results"):
                response = {
                    "response": self.format_generic_response(rag_result),
                    "source": "rag",
                    "results_count": len(rag_result["results"])
                }
            else:
                response = {
                    "response": "Processando sua solicitaÃ§Ã£o...",
                    "source": "default"
                }
        
        # Adicionar ao cache
        self.knowledge_cache[cache_key] = response
        
        return response
    
    def format_rag_response(self, result: Dict) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """

        """
        if not result.get("results"):
            return {"response": "Sem resultados", "source": "rag"}
        
        # Construir resposta
        response_text = f"**{result['topic'].upper()}**\n\n"
        
        for item in result["results"]:
            if item.get("content"):
                response_text += f"{item['content'][:500]}\n\n"
        
        return {
            "response": response_text,
            "source": "rag",
            "topic": result["topic"],
            "results_count": result["total_found"]
        }
    
    def format_generic_response(self, rag_result: Dict) -> str:
        """
        Formata resposta genÃ©rica do RAG
        """
        if not rag_result.get("results"):
            return "Sem informaÃ§Ãµes disponÃ­veis."
        
        response = "Baseado na base de conhecimento:\n\n"
        for item in rag_result["results"][:3]:
            if item.get("content"):
                response += f"â€¢ {item['content'][:200]}...\n"
        
        return response


# Exemplo de uso
if __name__ == "__main__":
    async def test_integration():
        # Criar agente com RAG
        agent = MarvinRAGAgent()
        
        # Testar consultas
        queries = [
            "O que sÃ£o Agent Cards no A2A?",
            "Como implementar um agente A2A?",

        ]

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Marvin Agent - Agente auxiliar inteligente
"""

import logging
import asyncio
from typing import Any, Dict, Optional
from datetime import datetime

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)


class MarvinAgent:
    """
    Agente Marvin com capacidades de anÃ¡lise, execuÃ§Ã£o e assistÃªncia
    """
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.name = "Marvin Agent"
        self.version = "1.0.0"
        self.capabilities = [
            "anÃ¡lise de dados",
            "execuÃ§Ã£o de tarefas",
            "assistÃªncia geral",
            "aprendizado contÃ­nuo"
        ]
        self.memory = {}  # MemÃ³ria simples para contexto
        logger.info(f"Marvin Agent inicializado - v{self.version}")
    
    async def analyze(self, data: Any) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Analisa dados e fornece insights
        """
        logger.info(f"Analisando dados: {type(data)}")
        
        analysis = {
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "data_type": str(type(data)),
            "insights": [],
            "recommendations": []
        }
        
        # AnÃ¡lise bÃ¡sica
        if isinstance(data, str):
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Texto com {len(data)} caracteres")
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Palavras: {len(data.split())}")
            
        elif isinstance(data, dict):
            analysis["insights"].append(f"DicionÃ¡rio com {len(data)} chaves")
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Chaves: {list(data.keys())}")
            
        elif isinstance(data, list):
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Lista com {len(data)} elementos")
            
        analysis["recommendations"].append("AnÃ¡lise concluÃ­da com sucesso")
        
        return analysis
    
    async def execute_task(self, task: str, params: Optional[Dict] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Executa uma tarefa especÃ­fica
        """
        logger.info(f"Executando tarefa: {task}")
        
        result = {
            "task": task,
            "status": "completed",
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "params": params or {},
            "output": None
        }
        
        # Simular execuÃ§Ã£o de diferentes tipos de tarefas
        if "anÃ¡lise" in task.lower() or "analyze" in task.lower():
            result["output"] = await self.analyze(params.get("data") if params else {})
            
        elif "ajuda" in task.lower() or "help" in task.lower():
            result["output"] = await self.provide_assistance(task)
            
        else:
            result["output"] = f"Tarefa '{task}' executada com sucesso"
            
        return result
    
    async def extract_data(self, text: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Extrai dados estruturados de texto nÃ£o estruturado
        """
        import re
        logger.info(f"Extraindo dados do texto")
        
        extraction = {
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "source_text": text,
            "extracted_data": {},
            "entities": {
                "names": [],
                "emails": [],
                "phones": [],
                "companies": [],
                "positions": [],
                "urls": [],
                "dates": [],
                "numbers": []
            }
        }
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de emails
        email_pattern = r'\b[A-Za-z0-9._%+-]+@[A-Za-z0-9.-]+\.[A-Z|a-z]{2,}\b'
        extraction["entities"]["emails"] = re.findall(email_pattern, text)
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de telefones (vÃ¡rios formatos)
        phone_patterns = [
            r'\b\d{3}[-.\s]?\d{3}[-.\s]?\d{4}\b',  # XXX-XXX-XXXX
            r'\b\d{2}[-.\s]?\d{4,5}[-.\s]?\d{4}\b',  # XX-XXXX-XXXX
            r'\b\d{9,11}\b',  # NÃºmeros simples
            r'\b\(\d{2,3}\)\s?\d{4,5}[-.\s]?\d{4}\b'  # (XX) XXXXX-XXXX
        ]
        for pattern in phone_patterns:
            extraction["entities"]["phones"].extend(re.findall(pattern, text))
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de URLs
        url_pattern = r'https?://[^\s]+'
        extraction["entities"]["urls"] = re.findall(url_pattern, text)
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de nomes prÃ³prios (heurÃ­stica simples)
        # Procura por palavras capitalizadas consecutivas
        name_pattern = r'\b[A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)+\b'
        potential_names = re.findall(name_pattern, text)
        extraction["entities"]["names"] = potential_names
        
        # Identificar cargos/posiÃ§Ãµes comuns
        position_keywords = ['CEO', 'CTO', 'CFO', 'diretor', 'gerente', 'coordenador', 
                           'analista', 'desenvolvedor', 'engenheiro', 'designer', 
                           'presidente', 'vice-presidente', 'supervisor']
        text_lower = text.lower()
        for keyword in position_keywords:
            if keyword.lower() in text_lower:
                extraction["entities"]["positions"].append(keyword)
        
        # Identificar empresas (palavras antes de termos como "empresa", "ltda", etc)
        company_indicators = ['empresa', 'ltda', 'inc', 'corp', 'company', 'agentes']
        for indicator in company_indicators:
            pattern = r'\b(\w+(?:\s+\w+)*)\s+' + indicator + r'\b'
            companies = re.findall(pattern, text, re.IGNORECASE)
            extraction["entities"]["companies"].extend(companies)
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de nÃºmeros
        number_pattern = r'\b\d+(?:\.\d+)?\b'
        extraction["entities"]["numbers"] = re.findall(number_pattern, text)
        
        # Criar estrutura de dados extraÃ­dos
        if extraction["entities"]["names"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["nome"] = extraction["entities"]["names"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["emails"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["email"] = extraction["entities"]["emails"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["phones"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["telefone"] = extraction["entities"]["phones"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["companies"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["empresa"] = extraction["entities"]["companies"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["positions"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["cargo"] = extraction["entities"]["positions"][0]
        
        # Adicionar estatÃ­sticas
        extraction["statistics"] = {
            "total_entities_found": sum(len(v) for v in extraction["entities"].values()),
            "entity_types_found": len([k for k, v in extraction["entities"].items() if v])
        }
        
        return extraction
    
    async def provide_assistance(self, query: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Fornece assistÃªncia baseada na consulta
        """
        logger.info(f"Fornecendo assistÃªncia para: {query}")
        
        # Verificar se Ã© uma solicitaÃ§Ã£o de extraÃ§Ã£o
        extraction_keywords = ['extraia', 'extrai', 'extract', 'parse', 'identifique', 
                              'encontre', 'busque', 'procure']
        
        if any(keyword in query.lower() for keyword in extraction_keywords):
            # Ã‰ uma solicitaÃ§Ã£o de extraÃ§Ã£o
            extraction_result = await self.extract_data(query)
            return extraction_result
        
        assistance = {
            "query": query,
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "response": "",
            "suggestions": []
        }
        
        # Respostas baseadas em palavras-chave
        if "como" in query.lower():
            assistance["response"] = "Vou te ajudar com instruÃ§Ãµes passo a passo."
            assistance["suggestions"] = [
                "Defina claramente o objetivo",
                "Quebre em tarefas menores",
                "Execute uma tarefa por vez"
            ]
            
        elif "o que" in query.lower():
            assistance["response"] = "Vou explicar o conceito para vocÃª."
            assistance["suggestions"] = [
                "Analise o contexto",
                "Identifique os componentes principais",
                "Entenda as relaÃ§Ãµes entre eles"
            ]
            
        else:
            assistance["response"] = "Estou aqui para ajudar com qualquer dÃºvida."
            assistance["suggestions"] = [
                "Seja especÃ­fico em sua pergunta",
                "ForneÃ§a contexto quando possÃ­vel",
                "NÃ£o hesite em pedir esclarecimentos"
            ]
            
        return assistance
    
    async def learn(self, key: str, value: Any) -> bool:
        """
        Armazena informaÃ§Ã£o na memÃ³ria para aprendizado
        """
        logger.info(f"Aprendendo: {key}")
        
        self.memory[key] = {
            "value": value,
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
        }
        
        return True
    
    async def recall(self, key: str) -> Optional[Any]:
        """
        Recupera informaÃ§Ã£o da memÃ³ria
        """
        logger.info(f"Recuperando: {key}")
        
        if key in self.memory:
            return self.memory[key]
        
        return None
    
    async def process_request(self, request: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Processa uma requisiÃ§Ã£o genÃ©rica
        """
        logger.info(f"Processando requisiÃ§Ã£o: {request.get('type', 'unknown')}")
        
        request_type = request.get("type", "").lower()
        data = request.get("data", {})
        
        try:
            if request_type == "analyze":
                return await self.analyze(data)
                
            elif request_type == "execute":
                task = data.get("task", "")
                params = data.get("params", {})
                return await self.execute_task(task, params)
                
            elif request_type == "assist":
                query = data.get("query", "")
                return await self.provide_assistance(query)
                
            elif request_type == "learn":
                key = data.get("key", "")
                value = data.get("value", "")
                success = await self.learn(key, value)
                return {"success": success, "message": f"Aprendido: {key}"}
                
            elif request_type == "recall":
                key = data.get("key", "")
                memory = await self.recall(key)
                return {"key": key, "memory": memory}
                
            else:
                return {
                    "error": f"Tipo de requisiÃ§Ã£o nÃ£o reconhecido: {request_type}",
                    "supported_types": ["analyze", "execute", "assist", "learn", "recall"]
                }
                
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Erro ao processar requisiÃ§Ã£o: {e}")
            return {
                "error": str(e),
                "request": request
            }
    
    def __repr__(self):
        return f"<MarvinAgent v{self.version}>"

                }

            logger.error(f"Erro ao processar requisiÃ§Ã£o: {e}")
            return {
                "error": str(e),
                "request": request
            }

        return f"<MarvinAgent v{self.version}>"

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Marvin Agent - Agente auxiliar inteligente
"""

import logging
import asyncio
from typing import Any, Dict, Optional
from datetime import datetime

# Tentar importar integraÃ§Ã£o com RAG
try:
    from .rag_integration import MarvinRAGAgent, RAGIntegration
    RAG_AVAILABLE = True
except ImportError:
    RAG_AVAILABLE = False

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)


class MarvinAgent:
    """
    Agente Marvin com capacidades de anÃ¡lise, execuÃ§Ã£o e assistÃªncia
    """
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.name = "Marvin Agent"
        self.version = "1.0.0"
        self.capabilities = [
            "anÃ¡lise de dados",
            "execuÃ§Ã£o de tarefas",
            "assistÃªncia geral",
            "aprendizado contÃ­nuo",
            "extraÃ§Ã£o de dados estruturados"
        ]
        self.memory = {}  # MemÃ³ria simples para contexto
        
        # IntegraÃ§Ã£o com RAG se disponÃ­vel
        self.rag_agent = None
        if RAG_AVAILABLE:
            try:
                self.rag_agent = MarvinRAGAgent()
                self.capabilities.append("consulta base de conhecimento RAG")
                logger.info("âœ… IntegraÃ§Ã£o com RAG ativada")
            except Exception as e:
                logger.warning(f"âš ï¸ RAG disponÃ­vel mas nÃ£o inicializado: {e}")
        
        logger.info(f"Marvin Agent inicializado - v{self.version}")
    
    async def analyze(self, data: Any) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Analisa dados e fornece insights
        """
        logger.info(f"Analisando dados: {type(data)}")
        
        analysis = {
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "data_type": str(type(data)),
            "insights": [],
            "recommendations": []
        }
        
        # AnÃ¡lise bÃ¡sica
        if isinstance(data, str):
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Texto com {len(data)} caracteres")
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Palavras: {len(data.split())}")
            
        elif isinstance(data, dict):
            analysis["insights"].append(f"DicionÃ¡rio com {len(data)} chaves")
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Chaves: {list(data.keys())}")
            
        elif isinstance(data, list):
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Lista com {len(data)} elementos")
            
        analysis["recommendations"].append("AnÃ¡lise concluÃ­da com sucesso")
        
        return analysis
    
    async def execute_task(self, task: str, params: Optional[Dict] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Executa uma tarefa especÃ­fica
        """
        logger.info(f"Executando tarefa: {task}")
        
        result = {
            "task": task,
            "status": "completed",
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "params": params or {},
            "output": None
        }
        
        # Simular execuÃ§Ã£o de diferentes tipos de tarefas
        if "anÃ¡lise" in task.lower() or "analyze" in task.lower():
            result["output"] = await self.analyze(params.get("data") if params else {})
            
        elif "ajuda" in task.lower() or "help" in task.lower():
            result["output"] = await self.provide_assistance(task)
            
        else:
            result["output"] = f"Tarefa '{task}' executada com sucesso"
            
        return result
    
    async def extract_data(self, text: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Extrai dados estruturados de texto nÃ£o estruturado
        """
        import re
        logger.info(f"Extraindo dados do texto")
        
        extraction = {
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "source_text": text,
            "extracted_data": {},
            "entities": {
                "names": [],
                "emails": [],
                "phones": [],
                "companies": [],
                "positions": [],
                "urls": [],
                "dates": [],
                "numbers": []
            }
        }
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de emails
        email_pattern = r'\b[A-Za-z0-9._%+-]+@[A-Za-z0-9.-]+\.[A-Z|a-z]{2,}\b'
        extraction["entities"]["emails"] = re.findall(email_pattern, text)
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de telefones (vÃ¡rios formatos)
        phone_patterns = [
            r'\b\d{3}[-.\s]?\d{3}[-.\s]?\d{4}\b',  # XXX-XXX-XXXX
            r'\b\d{2}[-.\s]?\d{4,5}[-.\s]?\d{4}\b',  # XX-XXXX-XXXX
            r'\b\d{9,11}\b',  # NÃºmeros simples
            r'\b\(\d{2,3}\)\s?\d{4,5}[-.\s]?\d{4}\b'  # (XX) XXXXX-XXXX
        ]
        for pattern in phone_patterns:
            extraction["entities"]["phones"].extend(re.findall(pattern, text))
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de URLs
        url_pattern = r'https?://[^\s]+'
        extraction["entities"]["urls"] = re.findall(url_pattern, text)
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de nomes prÃ³prios (heurÃ­stica simples)
        # Procura por palavras capitalizadas consecutivas
        name_pattern = r'\b[A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)+\b'
        potential_names = re.findall(name_pattern, text)
        extraction["entities"]["names"] = potential_names
        
        # Identificar cargos/posiÃ§Ãµes comuns
        position_keywords = ['CEO', 'CTO', 'CFO', 'diretor', 'gerente', 'coordenador', 
                           'analista', 'desenvolvedor', 'engenheiro', 'designer', 
                           'presidente', 'vice-presidente', 'supervisor']
        text_lower = text.lower()
        for keyword in position_keywords:
            if keyword.lower() in text_lower:
                extraction["entities"]["positions"].append(keyword)
        
        # Identificar empresas (palavras antes de termos como "empresa", "ltda", etc)
        company_indicators = ['empresa', 'ltda', 'inc', 'corp', 'company', 'agentes']
        for indicator in company_indicators:
            pattern = r'\b(\w+(?:\s+\w+)*)\s+' + indicator + r'\b'
            companies = re.findall(pattern, text, re.IGNORECASE)
            extraction["entities"]["companies"].extend(companies)
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de nÃºmeros
        number_pattern = r'\b\d+(?:\.\d+)?\b'
        extraction["entities"]["numbers"] = re.findall(number_pattern, text)
        
        # Criar estrutura de dados extraÃ­dos
        if extraction["entities"]["names"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["nome"] = extraction["entities"]["names"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["emails"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["email"] = extraction["entities"]["emails"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["phones"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["telefone"] = extraction["entities"]["phones"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["companies"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["empresa"] = extraction["entities"]["companies"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["positions"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["cargo"] = extraction["entities"]["positions"][0]
        
        # Adicionar estatÃ­sticas
        extraction["statistics"] = {
            "total_entities_found": sum(len(v) for v in extraction["entities"].values()),
            "entity_types_found": len([k for k, v in extraction["entities"].items() if v])
        }
        
        return extraction
    
    async def provide_assistance(self, query: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Fornece assistÃªncia baseada na consulta
        """
        logger.info(f"Fornecendo assistÃªncia para: {query}")
        
        # Verificar se Ã© uma solicitaÃ§Ã£o de extraÃ§Ã£o
        extraction_keywords = ['extraia', 'extrai', 'extract', 'parse', 'identifique', 
                              'encontre', 'busque', 'procure']
        
        if any(keyword in query.lower() for keyword in extraction_keywords):
            # Ã‰ uma solicitaÃ§Ã£o de extraÃ§Ã£o
            extraction_result = await self.extract_data(query)

        }

        if "como" in query.lower():
            assistance["response"] = "Vou te ajudar com instruÃ§Ãµes passo a passo."
            assistance["suggestions"] = [
                "Defina claramente o objetivo",
                "Quebre em tarefas menores",
                "Execute uma tarefa por vez"
            ]
            
        elif "o que" in query.lower():
            assistance["response"] = "Vou explicar o conceito para vocÃª."
            assistance["suggestions"] = [
                "Analise o contexto",
                "Identifique os componentes principais",
                "Entenda as relaÃ§Ãµes entre eles"
            ]
            
        else:
            assistance["response"] = "Estou aqui para ajudar com qualquer dÃºvida."
            assistance["suggestions"] = [
                "Seja especÃ­fico em sua pergunta",
                "ForneÃ§a contexto quando possÃ­vel",
                "NÃ£o hesite em pedir esclarecimentos"
            ]
            
        return assistance
    
    async def learn(self, key: str, value: Any) -> bool:
        """
        Armazena informaÃ§Ã£o na memÃ³ria para aprendizado
        """
        logger.info(f"Aprendendo: {key}")
        
        self.memory[key] = {
            "value": value,

        }
        
        return True
    
    async def recall(self, key: str) -> Optional[Any]:

        """
        logger.info(f"Recuperando: {key}")

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Marvin Agent - Agente auxiliar inteligente
"""

import logging
import asyncio
from typing import Any, Dict, Optional
from datetime import datetime

# Tentar importar integraÃ§Ã£o com RAG
try:
    from .rag_integration import MarvinRAGAgent, RAGIntegration
    RAG_AVAILABLE = True
except ImportError:
    RAG_AVAILABLE = False

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)


class MarvinAgent:
    """
    Agente Marvin com capacidades de anÃ¡lise, execuÃ§Ã£o e assistÃªncia
    """
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.name = "Marvin Agent"
        self.version = "1.0.0"
        self.capabilities = [
            "anÃ¡lise de dados",
            "execuÃ§Ã£o de tarefas",
            "assistÃªncia geral",
            "aprendizado contÃ­nuo",
            "extraÃ§Ã£o de dados estruturados"
        ]
        self.memory = {}  # MemÃ³ria simples para contexto
        
        # IntegraÃ§Ã£o com RAG se disponÃ­vel
        self.rag_agent = None
        if RAG_AVAILABLE:
            try:
                self.rag_agent = MarvinRAGAgent()
                self.capabilities.append("consulta base de conhecimento RAG")
                logger.info("âœ… IntegraÃ§Ã£o com RAG ativada")
            except Exception as e:
                logger.warning(f"âš ï¸ RAG disponÃ­vel mas nÃ£o inicializado: {e}")
        
        logger.info(f"Marvin Agent inicializado - v{self.version}")
    
    async def analyze(self, data: Any) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Analisa dados e fornece insights
        """
        logger.info(f"Analisando dados: {type(data)}")
        
        analysis = {
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "data_type": str(type(data)),
            "insights": [],
            "recommendations": []
        }
        
        # AnÃ¡lise bÃ¡sica
        if isinstance(data, str):
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Texto com {len(data)} caracteres")
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Palavras: {len(data.split())}")
            
        elif isinstance(data, dict):
            analysis["insights"].append(f"DicionÃ¡rio com {len(data)} chaves")
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Chaves: {list(data.keys())}")
            
        elif isinstance(data, list):
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Lista com {len(data)} elementos")
            
        analysis["recommendations"].append("AnÃ¡lise concluÃ­da com sucesso")
        
        return analysis
    
    async def execute_task(self, task: str, params: Optional[Dict] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Executa uma tarefa especÃ­fica
        """
        logger.info(f"Executando tarefa: {task}")
        
        result = {
            "task": task,
            "status": "completed",
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "params": params or {},
            "output": None
        }
        
        # Simular execuÃ§Ã£o de diferentes tipos de tarefas
        if "anÃ¡lise" in task.lower() or "analyze" in task.lower():
            result["output"] = await self.analyze(params.get("data") if params else {})
            
        elif "ajuda" in task.lower() or "help" in task.lower():
            result["output"] = await self.provide_assistance(task)
            
        else:
            result["output"] = f"Tarefa '{task}' executada com sucesso"
            
        return result
    
    async def extract_data(self, text: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Extrai dados estruturados de texto nÃ£o estruturado
        """
        import re
        logger.info(f"Extraindo dados do texto")
        
        extraction = {
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "source_text": text,
            "extracted_data": {},
            "entities": {
                "names": [],
                "emails": [],
                "phones": [],
                "companies": [],
                "positions": [],
                "urls": [],
                "dates": [],
                "numbers": []
            }
        }
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de emails
        email_pattern = r'\b[A-Za-z0-9._%+-]+@[A-Za-z0-9.-]+\.[A-Z|a-z]{2,}\b'
        extraction["entities"]["emails"] = re.findall(email_pattern, text)
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de telefones (vÃ¡rios formatos)
        phone_patterns = [
            r'\b\d{3}[-.\s]?\d{3}[-.\s]?\d{4}\b',  # XXX-XXX-XXXX
            r'\b\d{2}[-.\s]?\d{4,5}[-.\s]?\d{4}\b',  # XX-XXXX-XXXX
            r'\b\d{9,11}\b',  # NÃºmeros simples
            r'\b\(\d{2,3}\)\s?\d{4,5}[-.\s]?\d{4}\b'  # (XX) XXXXX-XXXX
        ]
        for pattern in phone_patterns:
            extraction["entities"]["phones"].extend(re.findall(pattern, text))
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de URLs
        url_pattern = r'https?://[^\s]+'
        extraction["entities"]["urls"] = re.findall(url_pattern, text)
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de nomes prÃ³prios (heurÃ­stica simples)
        # Procura por palavras capitalizadas consecutivas
        name_pattern = r'\b[A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)+\b'
        potential_names = re.findall(name_pattern, text)
        extraction["entities"]["names"] = potential_names
        
        # Identificar cargos/posiÃ§Ãµes comuns
        position_keywords = ['CEO', 'CTO', 'CFO', 'diretor', 'gerente', 'coordenador', 
                           'analista', 'desenvolvedor', 'engenheiro', 'designer', 
                           'presidente', 'vice-presidente', 'supervisor']
        text_lower = text.lower()
        for keyword in position_keywords:
            if keyword.lower() in text_lower:
                extraction["entities"]["positions"].append(keyword)
        
        # Identificar empresas (palavras antes de termos como "empresa", "ltda", etc)
        company_indicators = ['empresa', 'ltda', 'inc', 'corp', 'company', 'agentes']
        for indicator in company_indicators:
            pattern = r'\b(\w+(?:\s+\w+)*)\s+' + indicator + r'\b'
            companies = re.findall(pattern, text, re.IGNORECASE)
            extraction["entities"]["companies"].extend(companies)
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de nÃºmeros
        number_pattern = r'\b\d+(?:\.\d+)?\b'
        extraction["entities"]["numbers"] = re.findall(number_pattern, text)
        
        # Criar estrutura de dados extraÃ­dos
        if extraction["entities"]["names"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["nome"] = extraction["entities"]["names"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["emails"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["email"] = extraction["entities"]["emails"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["phones"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["telefone"] = extraction["entities"]["phones"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["companies"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["empresa"] = extraction["entities"]["companies"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["positions"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["cargo"] = extraction["entities"]["positions"][0]
        
        # Adicionar estatÃ­sticas
        extraction["statistics"] = {
            "total_entities_found": sum(len(v) for v in extraction["entities"].values()),
            "entity_types_found": len([k for k, v in extraction["entities"].items() if v])
        }
        
        return extraction
    
    async def provide_assistance(self, query: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Fornece assistÃªncia baseada na consulta
        """
        logger.info(f"Fornecendo assistÃªncia para: {query}")
        
        # Verificar se Ã© uma solicitaÃ§Ã£o de extraÃ§Ã£o
        extraction_keywords = ['extraia', 'extrai', 'extract', 'parse', 'identifique', 
                              'encontre', 'busque', 'procure']
        
        if any(keyword in query.lower() for keyword in extraction_keywords):
            # Ã‰ uma solicitaÃ§Ã£o de extraÃ§Ã£o
            extraction_result = await self.extract_data(query)
            return extraction_result
        
        # Verificar se deve usar RAG para consultas sobre A2A
        if self.rag_agent and any(term in query.lower() for term in ["a2a", "agent card", "protocol", "skill", "mcp"]):
            logger.info("Consultando base de conhecimento RAG sobre A2A")
            rag_result = await self.rag_agent.process_with_rag(query)
            return {
                "query": query,
                "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
                "response": rag_result.get("response", ""),
                "source": "rag",
                "suggestions": ["Consulte a documentaÃ§Ã£o A2A completa", "Verifique os exemplos prÃ¡ticos"]
            }
        
        assistance = {
            "query": query,
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "response": "",
            "suggestions": []
        }
        
        # Respostas baseadas em palavras-chave
        if "como" in query.lower():
            assistance["response"] = "Vou te ajudar com instruÃ§Ãµes passo a passo."
            assistance["suggestions"] = [
                "Defina claramente o objetivo",
                "Quebre em tarefas menores",
                "Execute uma tarefa por vez"
            ]
            
        elif "o que" in query.lower():
            assistance["response"] = "Vou explicar o conceito para vocÃª."
            assistance["suggestions"] = [
                "Analise o contexto",
                "Identifique os componentes principais",
                "Entenda as relaÃ§Ãµes entre eles"
            ]
            
        else:
            assistance["response"] = "Estou aqui para ajudar com qualquer dÃºvida."
            assistance["suggestions"] = [
                "Seja especÃ­fico em sua pergunta",
                "ForneÃ§a contexto quando possÃ­vel",
                "NÃ£o hesite em pedir esclarecimentos"
            ]
            
        return assistance
    
    async def learn(self, key: str, value: Any) -> bool:
        """
        Armazena informaÃ§Ã£o na memÃ³ria para aprendizado
        """
        logger.info(f"Aprendendo: {key}")
        
        self.memory[key] = {
            "value": value,
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
        }
        
        return True
    
    async def recall(self, key: str) -> Optional[Any]:
        """
        Recupera informaÃ§Ã£o da memÃ³ria
        """
        logger.info(f"Recuperando: {key}")
        
        if key in self.memory:
            return self.memory[key]
        
        return None
    
    async def process_request(self, request: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Processa uma requisiÃ§Ã£o genÃ©rica
        """
        logger.info(f"Processando requisiÃ§Ã£o: {request.get('type', 'unknown')}")
        
        request_type = request.get("type", "").lower()
        data = request.get("data", {})
        
        try:
            if request_type == "analyze":
                return await self.analyze(data)
                
            elif request_type == "execute":
                task = data.get("task", "")
                params = data.get("params", {})
                return await self.execute_task(task, params)
                
            elif request_type == "assist":
                query = data.get("query", "")
                return await self.provide_assistance(query)
                
            elif request_type == "learn":
                key = data.get("key", "")
                value = data.get("value", "")
                success = await self.learn(key, value)
                return {"success": success, "message": f"Aprendido: {key}"}
                
            elif request_type == "recall":
                key = data.get("key", "")
                memory = await self.recall(key)
                return {"key": key, "memory": memory}
                
            else:
                return {
                    "error": f"Tipo de requisiÃ§Ã£o nÃ£o reconhecido: {request_type}",
                    "supported_types": ["analyze", "execute", "assist", "learn", "recall"]
                }
                
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Erro ao processar requisiÃ§Ã£o: {e}")
            return {
                "error": str(e),
                "request": request
            }
    
    def __repr__(self):
        return f"<MarvinAgent v{self.version}>"

                }
                
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Erro ao processar requisiÃ§Ã£o: {e}")
            return {
                "error": str(e),
                "request": request
            }
    
    def __repr__(self):
        return f"<MarvinAgent v{self.version}>"

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Marvin Agent - Agente auxiliar inteligente
"""

import logging
import asyncio
from typing import Any, Dict, Optional
from datetime import datetime

# Tentar importar integraÃ§Ã£o com RAG
try:
    from .simple_rag import MarvinWithRAG
    RAG_AVAILABLE = True
except ImportError:
    try:
        from simple_rag import MarvinWithRAG
        RAG_AVAILABLE = True
    except ImportError:
        RAG_AVAILABLE = False

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)


class MarvinAgent:
    """
    Agente Marvin com capacidades de anÃ¡lise, execuÃ§Ã£o e assistÃªncia
    """
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.name = "Marvin Agent"
        self.version = "1.0.0"
        self.capabilities = [
            "anÃ¡lise de dados",
            "execuÃ§Ã£o de tarefas",
            "assistÃªncia geral",
            "aprendizado contÃ­nuo",
            "extraÃ§Ã£o de dados estruturados"
        ]
        self.memory = {}  # MemÃ³ria simples para contexto
        
        # IntegraÃ§Ã£o com RAG se disponÃ­vel
        self.rag_agent = None
        if RAG_AVAILABLE:
            try:
                self.rag_agent = MarvinWithRAG()
                self.capabilities.append("consulta base de conhecimento A2A")
                logger.info("âœ… IntegraÃ§Ã£o com documentaÃ§Ã£o A2A ativada")
            except Exception as e:
                logger.warning(f"âš ï¸ RAG disponÃ­vel mas nÃ£o inicializado: {e}")
        
        logger.info(f"Marvin Agent inicializado - v{self.version}")
    
    async def analyze(self, data: Any) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Analisa dados e fornece insights
        """
        logger.info(f"Analisando dados: {type(data)}")
        
        analysis = {
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "data_type": str(type(data)),
            "insights": [],
            "recommendations": []
        }
        
        # AnÃ¡lise bÃ¡sica
        if isinstance(data, str):
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Texto com {len(data)} caracteres")
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Palavras: {len(data.split())}")
            
        elif isinstance(data, dict):
            analysis["insights"].append(f"DicionÃ¡rio com {len(data)} chaves")
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Chaves: {list(data.keys())}")
            
        elif isinstance(data, list):
            analysis["insights"].append(f"Lista com {len(data)} elementos")
            
        analysis["recommendations"].append("AnÃ¡lise concluÃ­da com sucesso")
        
        return analysis
    
    async def execute_task(self, task: str, params: Optional[Dict] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Executa uma tarefa especÃ­fica
        """
        logger.info(f"Executando tarefa: {task}")
        
        result = {
            "task": task,
            "status": "completed",
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "params": params or {},
            "output": None
        }
        
        # Simular execuÃ§Ã£o de diferentes tipos de tarefas
        if "anÃ¡lise" in task.lower() or "analyze" in task.lower():
            result["output"] = await self.analyze(params.get("data") if params else {})
            
        elif "ajuda" in task.lower() or "help" in task.lower():
            result["output"] = await self.provide_assistance(task)
            
        else:
            result["output"] = f"Tarefa '{task}' executada com sucesso"
            
        return result
    
    async def extract_data(self, text: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Extrai dados estruturados de texto nÃ£o estruturado
        """
        import re
        logger.info(f"Extraindo dados do texto")
        
        extraction = {
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "source_text": text,
            "extracted_data": {},
            "entities": {
                "names": [],
                "emails": [],
                "phones": [],
                "companies": [],
                "positions": [],
                "urls": [],
                "dates": [],
                "numbers": []
            }
        }
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de emails
        email_pattern = r'\b[A-Za-z0-9._%+-]+@[A-Za-z0-9.-]+\.[A-Z|a-z]{2,}\b'
        extraction["entities"]["emails"] = re.findall(email_pattern, text)
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de telefones (vÃ¡rios formatos)
        phone_patterns = [
            r'\b\d{3}[-.\s]?\d{3}[-.\s]?\d{4}\b',  # XXX-XXX-XXXX
            r'\b\d{2}[-.\s]?\d{4,5}[-.\s]?\d{4}\b',  # XX-XXXX-XXXX
            r'\b\d{9,11}\b',  # NÃºmeros simples
            r'\b\(\d{2,3}\)\s?\d{4,5}[-.\s]?\d{4}\b'  # (XX) XXXXX-XXXX
        ]
        for pattern in phone_patterns:
            extraction["entities"]["phones"].extend(re.findall(pattern, text))
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de URLs
        url_pattern = r'https?://[^\s]+'
        extraction["entities"]["urls"] = re.findall(url_pattern, text)
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de nomes prÃ³prios (heurÃ­stica simples)
        # Procura por palavras capitalizadas consecutivas
        name_pattern = r'\b[A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)+\b'
        potential_names = re.findall(name_pattern, text)
        extraction["entities"]["names"] = potential_names
        
        # Identificar cargos/posiÃ§Ãµes comuns
        position_keywords = ['CEO', 'CTO', 'CFO', 'diretor', 'gerente', 'coordenador', 
                           'analista', 'desenvolvedor', 'engenheiro', 'designer', 
                           'presidente', 'vice-presidente', 'supervisor']
        text_lower = text.lower()
        for keyword in position_keywords:
            if keyword.lower() in text_lower:
                extraction["entities"]["positions"].append(keyword)
        
        # Identificar empresas (palavras antes de termos como "empresa", "ltda", etc)
        company_indicators = ['empresa', 'ltda', 'inc', 'corp', 'company', 'agentes']
        for indicator in company_indicators:
            pattern = r'\b(\w+(?:\s+\w+)*)\s+' + indicator + r'\b'
            companies = re.findall(pattern, text, re.IGNORECASE)
            extraction["entities"]["companies"].extend(companies)
        
        # ExtraÃ§Ã£o de nÃºmeros
        number_pattern = r'\b\d+(?:\.\d+)?\b'
        extraction["entities"]["numbers"] = re.findall(number_pattern, text)
        
        # Criar estrutura de dados extraÃ­dos
        if extraction["entities"]["names"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["nome"] = extraction["entities"]["names"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["emails"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["email"] = extraction["entities"]["emails"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["phones"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["telefone"] = extraction["entities"]["phones"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["companies"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["empresa"] = extraction["entities"]["companies"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["positions"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["cargo"] = extraction["entities"]["positions"][0]
        
        # Adicionar estatÃ­sticas
        extraction["statistics"] = {
            "total_entities_found": sum(len(v) for v in extraction["entities"].values()),
            "entity_types_found": len([k for k, v in extraction["entities"].items() if v])
        }
        
        return extraction
    
    async def provide_assistance(self, query: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Fornece assistÃªncia baseada na consulta
        """
        logger.info(f"Fornecendo assistÃªncia para: {query}")
        
        # Verificar se Ã© uma solicitaÃ§Ã£o de extraÃ§Ã£o
        extraction_keywords = ['extraia', 'extrai', 'extract', 'parse', 'identifique', 
                              'encontre', 'busque', 'procure']
        
        if any(keyword in query.lower() for keyword in extraction_keywords):
            # Ã‰ uma solicitaÃ§Ã£o de extraÃ§Ã£o
            extraction_result = await self.extract_data(query)
            return extraction_result
        
        # Verificar se deve usar RAG para consultas sobre A2A
        if self.rag_agent and any(term in query.lower() for term in ["a2a", "agent card", "protocol", "skill", "mcp"]):
            logger.info("Consultando base de conhecimento RAG sobre A2A")
            rag_result = await self.rag_agent.process_with_rag(query)
            return {
                "query": query,
                "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
                "response": rag_result.get("response", ""),
                "source": "rag",
                "suggestions": ["Consulte a documentaÃ§Ã£o A2A completa", "Verifique os exemplos prÃ¡ticos"]
            }
        
        assistance = {
            "query": query,
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "response": "",
            "suggestions": []
        }
        
        # Respostas baseadas em palavras-chave
        if "como" in query.lower():
            assistance["response"] = "Vou te ajudar com instruÃ§Ãµes passo a passo."
            assistance["suggestions"] = [
                "Defina claramente o objetivo",
                "Quebre em tarefas menores",
                "Execute uma tarefa por vez"
            ]
            
        elif "o que" in query.lower():
            assistance["response"] = "Vou explicar o conceito para vocÃª."
            assistance["suggestions"] = [
                "Analise o contexto",
                "Identifique os componentes principais",
                "Entenda as relaÃ§Ãµes entre eles"
            ]
            
        else:
            assistance["response"] = "Estou aqui para ajudar com qualquer dÃºvida."
            assistance["suggestions"] = [
                "Seja especÃ­fico em sua pergunta",
                "ForneÃ§a contexto quando possÃ­vel",
                "NÃ£o hesite em pedir esclarecimentos"
            ]
            
        return assistance
    
    async def query_knowledge_base(self, query: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Consulta a base de conhecimento RAG
        """
        if not self.rag_agent:
            return {
                "error": "RAG nÃ£o disponÃ­vel",
                "message": "IntegraÃ§Ã£o com base de conhecimento nÃ£o estÃ¡ ativa"
            }
        
        try:
            logger.info(f"Consultando RAG: {query}")
            result = await self.rag_agent.process_with_rag(query)
            return result
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Erro ao consultar RAG: {e}")
            return {
                "error": str(e),
                "message": "Falha ao consultar base de conhecimento"
            }
    
    async def learn(self, key: str, value: Any) -> bool:
        """
        Armazena informaÃ§Ã£o na memÃ³ria para aprendizado
        """
        logger.info(f"Aprendendo: {key}")
        
        self.memory[key] = {
            "value": value,
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
        }
        
        return True
    
    async def recall(self, key: str) -> Optional[Any]:
        """
        Recupera informaÃ§Ã£o da memÃ³ria
        """
        logger.info(f"Recuperando: {key}")
        
        if key in self.memory:
            return self.memory[key]
        
        return None
    
    async def process_request(self, request: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Processa uma requisiÃ§Ã£o genÃ©rica
        """
        logger.info(f"Processando requisiÃ§Ã£o: {request.get('type', 'unknown')}")
        
        request_type = request.get("type", "").lower()
        data = request.get("data", {})
        
        try:
            if request_type == "analyze":
                return await self.analyze(data)
                
            elif request_type == "execute":
                task = data.get("task", "")
                params = data.get("params", {})
                return await self.execute_task(task, params)
                
            elif request_type == "assist":
                query = data.get("query", "")
                return await self.provide_assistance(query)
                
            elif request_type == "learn":
                key = data.get("key", "")
                value = data.get("value", "")
                success = await self.learn(key, value)
                return {"success": success, "message": f"Aprendido: {key}"}
                
            elif request_type == "recall":
                key = data.get("key", "")
                memory = await self.recall(key)
                return {"key": key, "memory": memory}
                
            else:
                return {
                    "error": f"Tipo de requisiÃ§Ã£o nÃ£o reconhecido: {request_type}",
                    "supported_types": ["analyze", "execute", "assist", "learn", "recall"]
                }
                
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Erro ao processar requisiÃ§Ã£o: {e}")
            return {
                "error": str(e),
                "request": request
            }
    
    def __repr__(self):
        return f"<MarvinAgent v{self.version}>"

            extraction["extracted_data"]["empresa"] = extraction["entities"]["companies"][0]
        if extraction["entities"]["positions"]:
            extraction["extracted_data"]["cargo"] = extraction["entities"]["positions"][0]
        
        # Adicionar estatÃ­sticas
        extraction["statistics"] = {
            "total_entities_found": sum(len(v) for v in extraction["entities"].values()),
            "entity_types_found": len([k for k, v in extraction["entities"].items() if v])
        }
        
        return extraction
    
    async def provide_assistance(self, query: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Fornece assistÃªncia baseada na consulta
        """
        logger.info(f"Fornecendo assistÃªncia para: {query}")
        
        # Verificar se Ã© uma solicitaÃ§Ã£o de extraÃ§Ã£o
        extraction_keywords = ['extraia', 'extrai', 'extract', 'parse', 'identifique', 
                              'encontre', 'busque', 'procure']
        
        if any(keyword in query.lower() for keyword in extraction_keywords):
            # Ã‰ uma solicitaÃ§Ã£o de extraÃ§Ã£o
            extraction_result = await self.extract_data(query)
            return extraction_result
        
        # Verificar se deve usar RAG para consultas sobre A2A
        if self.rag_agent and any(term in query.lower() for term in ["a2a", "agent card", "protocol", "skill", "mcp"]):
            logger.info("Consultando base de conhecimento sobre A2A")
            rag_result = await self.rag_agent.process_query(query)
            return {
                "query": query,
                "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
                "response": rag_result.get("response", ""),
                "source": rag_result.get("source", "rag"),
                "suggestions": ["Consulte a documentaÃ§Ã£o A2A completa", "Verifique os exemplos prÃ¡ticos"],
                "results_count": rag_result.get("results_count", 0)
            }
        
        assistance = {
            "query": query,
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "response": "",
            "suggestions": []
        }
        
        # Respostas baseadas em palavras-chave
        if "como" in query.lower():
            assistance["response"] = "Vou te ajudar com instruÃ§Ãµes passo a passo."
            assistance["suggestions"] = [
                "Defina claramente o objetivo",
                "Quebre em tarefas menores",
                "Execute uma tarefa por vez"
            ]
            
        elif "o que" in query.lower():
            assistance["response"] = "Vou explicar o conceito para vocÃª."
            assistance["suggestions"] = [
                "Analise o contexto",
                "Identifique os componentes principais",
                "Entenda as relaÃ§Ãµes entre eles"
            ]
            
        else:
            assistance["response"] = "Estou aqui para ajudar com qualquer dÃºvida."
            assistance["suggestions"] = [
                "Seja especÃ­fico em sua pergunta",
                "ForneÃ§a contexto quando possÃ­vel",
                "NÃ£o hesite em pedir esclarecimentos"
            ]
            
        return assistance
    
    async def query_knowledge_base(self, query: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Consulta a base de conhecimento RAG
        """
        if not self.rag_agent:
            return {
                "error": "RAG nÃ£o disponÃ­vel",
                "message": "IntegraÃ§Ã£o com base de conhecimento nÃ£o estÃ¡ ativa"
            }
        
        try:
            logger.info(f"Consultando RAG: {query}")
            result = await self.rag_agent.process_with_rag(query)
            return result
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Erro ao consultar RAG: {e}")
            return {
                "error": str(e),
                "message": "Falha ao consultar base de conhecimento"
            }
    
    async def learn(self, key: str, value: Any) -> bool:
        """
        Armazena informaÃ§Ã£o na memÃ³ria para aprendizado
        """
        logger.info(f"Aprendendo: {key}")
        
        self.memory[key] = {
            "value": value,
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
        }
        
        return True
    
    async def recall(self, key: str) -> Optional[Any]:
        """
        Recupera informaÃ§Ã£o da memÃ³ria
        """
        logger.info(f"Recuperando: {key}")
        
        if key in self.memory:
            return self.memory[key]
        
        return None
    
    async def process_request(self, request: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Processa uma requisiÃ§Ã£o genÃ©rica
        """
        logger.info(f"Processando requisiÃ§Ã£o: {request.get('type', 'unknown')}")
        
        request_type = request.get("type", "").lower()
        data = request.get("data", {})
        
        try:
            if request_type == "analyze":
                return await self.analyze(data)
                
            elif request_type == "execute":
                task = data.get("task", "")
                params = data.get("params", {})
                return await self.execute_task(task, params)
                
            elif request_type == "assist":
                query = data.get("query", "")
                return await self.provide_assistance(query)
                
            elif request_type == "learn":
                key = data.get("key", "")
                value = data.get("value", "")
                success = await self.learn(key, value)
                return {"success": success, "message": f"Aprendido: {key}"}
                
            elif request_type == "recall":
                key = data.get("key", "")
                memory = await self.recall(key)
                return {"key": key, "memory": memory}
                
            else:
                return {
                    "error": f"Tipo de requisiÃ§Ã£o nÃ£o reconhecido: {request_type}",
                    "supported_types": ["analyze", "execute", "assist", "learn", "recall"]
                }
                
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Erro ao processar requisiÃ§Ã£o: {e}")
            return {
                "error": str(e),
                "request": request
            }
    
    def __repr__(self):
        return f"<MarvinAgent v{self.version}>"

O Marvin estÃ¡ dando respostas genÃ©ricas em vez de respostas especÃ­ficas sobre suas capacidades. Veja os problemas:

1. **"ativo?"** â†’ Resposta genÃ©rica: "Estou aqui para ajudar"

2. **"o que vocÃª faz?"** â†’ Resposta genÃ©rica: "Vou explicar o conceito para vocÃª"

**O problema estÃ¡ aqui:**

O cÃ³digo estÃ¡ interpretando "o que" como pedido de explicaÃ§Ã£o genÃ©rica, em vez de responder sobre suas prÃ³prias capacidades. Vou corrigir:
